intro: Eremothamnus, commonly known as the desert thornbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. These shrubs are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia and are well adapted to dry environments. They typically have small, clustered leaves and produce bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plants are drought-tolerant and often serve as pioneer species in disturbed or degraded soils. Their ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various native animals.
